content.description: Take the easy ramp up left or head straight up the tricky start to place you first few pieces behind a loose flake. Work up the double crack system to the roof, where you follow underclinging handjams to liebacks out the left.
content.protection: No bolts.   Strong tree with slung anchor (quick links and webbing).   Gear from 0.1"-3"
content.location: This route is 50' to the left of Chocolate crack.

content.description: Start in the hand crack with lots of face holds to the left of "Poopsmear". Follow the cracks to the shared anchor.    Can be accessed from the top by walking up a small scramble up the left.
content.protection: Easily protected with a couple cams (BD #1,2,3).
content.location: When looking out on the ocean from the flats its the left most cliff and the left most route. Cross the small river to get the the boulders at the base.

content.description: This climb climbs the obvious giant flake and shares an anchor with crescent crack.
Follow the face holds and bolts, tending left the the shared anchor with "Thor's Hatchet"
content.location: Looking out at the ocean, the cliff is the left most wall. this is on the shorter left section. Starts to the right of Thor's Hatchet and to the left of Solstice Crack.

content.description: This is the left leaning dihedral crack. Shares an anchor with Solstice Crack
content.protection: Standard rack. Extra nuts or small cams.

content.description: A great climb, bomber hand jams and slightly over hanging. The moss falling in my eyes made it even more exciting. A desperate mossy top out to the bolts. Grungy and truly Alaskan climb. It could use a little cleaning and it would be even better.
content.location:
This route is along the road to Dyea, about two miles from the tidal flats. Keep your eye on the right side as you drive along. 

  Rap down

content.description: Easy lay-backing and hauling on juggy flakes make this an awesome learning climb.
content.protection: goes on bigger cams BD #2-4. Top roped by slinging trees.   Careful of sharp rock edge on TR!
content.location: Left of Solstice Crack and to the right of "Poopsmear".   Easy to walk off to the left.

content.description: This is the area of crags on the tidal flats at the old Dyea townsite.
